image.altText: Close-up of the hands of election workers counting votes

props.synopsis: With the methodical counting of votes crawling towards a result after the July 19 Tasmanian state election, some prominent faces might miss out — while others could scrape across the line.

title.children: Who might miss out thanks to Tasmania's 'brutal' vote counting system

image.altText: Aerial shot of ship being towed out of port.

props.synopsis: Since the Tasmanian parliament was dissolved for the election, the government has been operating in "caretaker mode". Labor has accused the Liberals of breaching the rules over two decisions.

title.children: Tasmanian Liberals accused of breaching caretaker conventions

image.altText: A woman reads with her baby and young son inside a library with glowing street lights reflected outside.

props.synopsis: Libraries have so much to offer, but their opening hours can make access difficult for those with busy lives. A Tasmanian program to allow after-hours access is winning over book fans, but unions say staff must not be left out of the initiative.

title.children: After-hours library access program winning users over for flexibility

image.altText: White smoke coming out of a metal chimney.

props.synopsis: Wood heaters are estimated to be responsible for more pollution-related deaths than all the cars on our roads. This national map shows which areas are affected the most.

title.children: Map reveals where 'silent killer' wood heater smoke is worst

image.altText: The Coroners Court of Victoria exterior in daylight.

props.synopsis: The mother of a baby boy who died after a planned home birth tells an inquest she assumed she would be transferred to hospital when complications first arose, but a midwife chose to monitor her "more closely".

title.children: Mother recalls 'what if' moment during home birth at baby death inquest

image.altText: A corrections official wearing his uniform, standing alongside a politician wearing a button-up shirt.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory government has flagged it will reinstate the use of spit hoods on young people in youth detention centres, almost eight years after the practice was banned.

title.children: NT government to bring back spit hoods years after practice was banned

image.altText: Graphic collage showing a Australian money, an ATO building, the myGov app, and a shadowy figure walking.

props.synopsis: It was a scam so simple it took just minutes on your phone, where you could tell the tax office how much money to pay you, and it came through within days.

title.children: How the ATO failed to stop a $2b scam so simple you could do it on your phone

image.altText: A woman in a red-and-white football uniform jumps onto the shoulders of a woman in a black-and-white uniform.

props.synopsis: AFLW burst onto the scene nine years ago with a lockout crowd but since then, crowds have dwindled. Here's how the league plans to get them back up.

title.children: AFLW has a crowd problem. Here's how the league wants to fix it

image.altText: Teenage girl sits up in bed and blows nose

props.synopsis: We may use terms like cold and the flu as if they are the same thing, but there are some key differences between them.

title.children: The key differences between a simple cold and something more serious

image.altText: Jane Dudley

props.synopsis: After 18 years with bipolar 1 disorder, an Australian woman's life has been changed by a poo transplant from her partner.

title.children: DIY poo transplant leads to 'miraculous' mental health change

image.altText: Edgewater crash

props.synopsis: The WA government will expand an inquiry into the safety of e-rideables to include electric dirt bikes, following the death of a 59-year-old woman in Perth.

title.children: Safety of electric dirt bikes in spotlight after death of woman in Perth park

image.altText: An overhead view of trucks carrying hay.

props.synopsis: A truck convoy that brought more than 6,000 bales of hay from WA to drought-stricken SA has begun making drop-offs and deliveries — and while farmers remain in need of more rain, the mood on their properties is being boosted.

title.children: Desperate SA farmers have 'faith in humanity' restored as hay comes in

image.altText: Group of protestors with pro-palestine signs next to a fire

props.synopsis: Main gates into Bisalloy Steel's NSW plant were blocked during protests against the armoured steel manufacturer's exports to Israel.

title.children: Protesters block gates of armoured steel plant over Israeli exports

image.altText: Alex de Minaur puts his arm around Alejandro Davidovich Fokina after their Washington DC Open final.

props.synopsis: Australia's Alex de Minaur wins an epic Washington DC Open final against Alejandro Davidovich Fokina, claiming his 10th singles title 7-3 in the final-set tiebreak.

title.children: De Minaur's classy move after stopping Spaniard from winning first title

image.altText: Three people touching a rusted box-shaped monument.

props.synopsis: When 11-year-old Annette Taylor suffered an unexpected cerebral brain haemorrhage and died four days later, she went on to make history.

title.children: How a mother-daughter conversation helped save two lives and start a legacy

image.altText: Queenie Tan looking at her laptop

props.synopsis: Income generated from side-hustles has become a major focus for the Australian Taxation Office (ATO), with digital service platforms such as YouTube and OnlyFans now legally required to report the income earned by their users.

title.children: What Queenie claims on tax as a content creator

image.altText: A man walking into court surrounded by journalists and TV cameramen.

props.synopsis: The star of hit Netflix series Wild Croc Territory, Matt Wright, has pleaded not guilty to attempting to pervert the course of justice ahead of a Supreme Court trial starting this week. It comes three years after a chopper accident which killed his co-star and close friend, Chris "Willow" Wilson.

title.children: Celebrity croc wrangler Matt Wright pleads not guilty ahead of Supreme Court trial

image.altText: A man in a dark suit and checkered tie speaks to reporters

props.synopsis: It was John Howard who described the Liberal Party as a "broad church" of voters, but its inability to agree on climate policy could narrow it considerably, writes Keane Bourke.

title.children: As state Liberal parties move away from net zero, leaders face battle for unity

image.altText: Police vehicles parked outside a shopping centre loading dock.

props.synopsis: A 29-year-old man allegedly wanted for serious crimes remains in hospital after being shot by an officer in the city over the weekend, as civil libertarians renew calls for a review into police shootings.

title.children: Fourth Townsville police shooting since January prompts call for inquiry

image.altText: Simon Stiell

props.synopsis: One of the world's top climate diplomats has urged the federal government to commit to an ambitious 2035 target to cut carbon emissions.

title.children: UN climate chief urges Australia to 'go big' on 2035 emissions target

image.altText: Ley and Albanese walk down the aisle in the senate chamber

props.synopsis: While the Liberals are showing signs they have not left the last election behind, Labor faces pressure from within to change its policy on Palestine.

title.children: Labor and Liberals facing internal fault lines as parliament resumes

image.altText: Ursula von der Leyen and Donald Trump sitting in a golf club meeting room.

props.synopsis: The deal, which sees European imports to the US levied a flat 15 per cent tariff, will affect a third of global trade.

title.children: US and European Union reach trade deal during Trump golf trip

image.altText: A close up photo of Donald Trump speaking to reporters at a cabinet table.

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump says Israel needs to "make a decision" about its next steps in Gaza, as more than 100 humanitarian agencies warn of mass starvation.

title.children: Trump says Gaza is a 'mess' as Israel denies starvation crisis

image.altText: A man in a dark suit crossing the street being filmed by camera operators

props.synopsis: A West Australian doctor charged with sexual offences against underage teenage girls pleads guilty to assaulting two of his accusers, as his court trial continues. WARNING: This article contains details that some readers may find distressing.

title.children: Doctor admits sexually assaulting two teenage girls

image.altText: A shopfront burnt and destroyed by fire

props.synopsis: NSW Health Minister Ryan Park raises concerns about a string of arson attacks on tobacconists after one in his own electorate is destroyed by fire at the weekend.

title.children: Health minister sounds alarm over another 'concerning' tobacconist fire

image.altText: A shadowy outline of a man sitting in a chair by a window

props.synopsis: There are growing calls from the youth and domestic and family violence sector for more financial support to assist the queer, trans and gender diverse community.

title.children: Alex's boyfriend put a tracking app on his phone 'to keep him safe'

image.altText: Outside the Western Sydney International Airport

props.synopsis: A former Western Sydney Airport executive procurement manager pleaded guilty to soliciting a corrupt commission after he attempted to invite a bribe from a company vying for a $5 million contract.

title.children: National anti-corruption watchdog hails its first prosecution

image.altText: An aerial shot of a flooded river submerging a road.

props.synopsis: As Western Australia's South West copped another cold front, the only sealed road into Gracetown was flooded on Sunday, cutting access to homes.

title.children: WA's South West lashed by rain, leaving residents stranded on weekend

image.altText: Landslide boulder at Great mackerel beach in Sydney's northern beaches

props.synopsis: In October 2020, a landslide cascaded down a slope in Sydney's Northern Beaches, sending down boulders that took out the side of the Kemp family's house.

title.children: Family stuck in limbo after landslide as NSW government refuses action

image.altText: A man in brown monk's robes stands in front of a Buddhist shrine.

props.synopsis: Shi Yongxin is alleged to have committed criminal offences and violated Buddhist precepts by maintaining relationships with multiple women.

title.children: 'CEO monk' head of Shaolin Temple under investigation for embezzlement

image.altText: England bowler Ben Stokes holds out his hand to India batters Ravindra Jadeja and Washington Sundar during a Test.

props.synopsis: England and India's Test series is still alive heading into game five after the tourists batted out a draw at Old Trafford with three batters notching centuries, much to Ben Stokes's chagrin.

title.children: 'Farcical': England angered by India batter getting first Test ton in draw

image.altText: Michelle Williams, Beyonce and Kelly Rowland on stage all wearing gold.

props.synopsis: The two special guests — dripping in gold and introduced by Beyoncé as"Destiny's Child's, b---!" —  performed a medley of the groups's biggest hits.

title.children: Destiny's Child reunites for Beyoncé's Cowboy Carter grand finale

image.altText: A man and woman stand in front of a house and a real estate "sold" sign.

props.synopsis: Coastal towns in central Queensland are being inundated with people wanting to move in, but councils are unable to process development applications fast enough to cater for demand.

title.children: Coastal growth sees house prices soar and town planning issues mount
